title: Looking for MIDI composing software
content: Hi, I need something like a MIDI composer (freeware or another kind of free software, for Windows). But I need a software that doesn't need a MIDI keyboard because I don't have one of those. Could you recommend something?"Eat your veggies!"

title: Re: Looking for MIDI composing software
content:
Try Noteworthy Composer. The demo version is nearly full-featured, and the full version is very cheap.________________
[img]http://img80.imageshack.us/img80/8498/missouriansf9.png[/img]

title: Well.
content: Midi maker is easy yet limited.

title: Re:
content:
I downloaded the NoteWorthy Composer evaluation version.. I converted one of the Keen music IMFs (the Keen5 help screen, I really like that theme![img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] ) to MIDI with IMF2MIDI, and I'm trying to do something with it (i.e. setting adequate instruments).
[hr]
"Eat your veggies!"

title: Re:
content:
If you can play a guitar, PowerTab is good. It's freeware.

Also, GuitarPro is a similar program which you have to pay for, but you can do percussion instruments in it. You can download a 16 day demo version of it though.


I haven't heard of these other programs. I'm going to give them a try.
crymorenub
